subject: Re: problem running junit within ant
msgSnippet: Eric, This works for me, using Ant 1.7 RC1, and JUnit 4.1 or 4.2. Buildfile: build.xml run-tests: [javac] Compiling 1 source file [junit] Testsuite: TestHello
messageBody:
Eric,

This works for me, using Ant 1.7 RC1, and JUnit 4.1 or 4.2.

Buildfile: build.xml

run-tests:
[javac] Compiling 1 source file
[junit] Testsuite: TestHello
[junit] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0,031
sec
[junit]

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 5 seconds


I added <formatter type="brief" usefile="false"/> to show the
testresults.


Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Eric Marshall <eric@...> wrote:
>
> I just downloaded the latest versions of junit and
> ant, and have copied the junit-4.1.jar into $ANT_HOME/lib.
> When I run ant, my trivial file compiles fine and junit is
> reported to run, but it always says the test FAILed, although
> I don't even have any assertions in the code. If I add a
> main method to the test which calls TestRunner.run, things
> seem to work better.
>
> Thanks in advance for helping out the noob.
>
>
> Here's my ant output:
>
> ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----
>
> Buildfile: build.xml
>
> run-tests:
> [javac] Compiling 1 source file
> [junit] Test TestHello FAILED
>
> BUILD SUCCESSFUL
>
> ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----
>
> and my minimal test class:
>
> ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----
>
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
>
> public class TestHello extends TestCase
> {
> public void testHello()
> {
> assertNull(null);
> }
> }
>
> ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----
>
> and my minimal build.xml file.
>
> ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< ----- 8< -----
>
> <project name="dummy" default="run-tests">
> <target name="run-tests">
> <javac srcDir="."/>
> <junit> <test name="TestHello"/> </junit>
> </target>
> </project>
>
